subject: Re: on screen representation of senior quikscript
msgSnippet: ... never ... This sounds like a great way to make it work. The senior font I ve kludged together to work with my QS senior parser is quite an eyesore while
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Paul Tremblay <phthenry@...> wrote:
>
> othermale wrote:
>
> >
> > Yes this makes good sense to me. As I say font editing is hardly my
> > specialty and drawing a whole alphabet from the ground up is not my
> > goal but working off of a good baseline with folks that know their
> > stuff would be quite cool.
> > The first concern that pops into my head however is character spacing:
> > junior needs it but senior can have none. Can one font do both?
> >
> > -Tony
> > (BTW, are you finding fontforge a good tool?)
>
> Sorry I didn't get back to you sooner. Two days is a long time in email.
>
> You can't have two types of spacing with one font. However, you can
> simply cut and paste all of my glyphs into your own boxes and then add
> anchors and work on spacing. Most of the time I have spent is with
> actually creating the shapes.
>
> I have created a set of basic shapes which hopefully would suit your
> need, but I have not yet finished perfecting these shapes. Do you have
> an account at sourceforge? If so, and if you want, I'll add you on as a
> developer.
>
> I have never used another font program besides fontforge, and have
never
> created my own font before now. However, I find fontforge to do
> everything I want it to. It seems an excellent tool to me.
>
> Paul
>

This sounds like a great way to make it work. The senior font I've
kludged together to work with my QS senior parser is quite an eyesore
while your font is really great looking and I'd love to try to get a
copy of it going with my parser. I have a sourceforge account user
name othermale.
